item.title: Re: Arena
item.content:encoded:
As near as I can tell, it works like this. Everyone in your rank and season (including you) is thrown into a pool that you get your fights from. If there's 6 people in your rank and season, then you have a 1/6 chance of getting your shadow. It is far more likely however that there is something like 500 people of your rank and season so it's closer to 1/500.

There also seems to be a 10%ish chance per fight that you will get someone from outside the pool. Could be stronger, could be weaker, could be both (higher season but lower rank for example).

Finally, during The Dark Hour, it seems that the pool is drawn from everyone who has a Moon, and there is no 10% chance of going outside it. If you're going for Destiny Warrior, don't do it during Dark Hour as the pool could conceivably contain everyone who has gotten to Season 2 Jonin.

A lot of this is conjecture, but it fits my experiences in the new Arena.

item.title: Re: Arena
item.content:encoded:
Yeah, that's the equivalent to the rewards you got in the old arena.

Win 10 matches in a day and get a Power related to your current Bloodline. Legacy get Jazz Hands, Red Eye get Eye of the Tiger, and White Eye get X-Ray Specs. Respectively, these give +3 Gen/Nin/Tai Strength in the Arena.

If you're Season 2+, 10 wins also gets you Doughman, needed for Monochrome.

Win 15 matches in a day, and get a Warrior. Wisdom for Legacy, Courage for Red Eye, and Power for White Eye. Respectively, they give +1 Gen/Nin/Tai Range everywhere, and you get 5 Stamina back when you attack a Kaiju of that particular Stat.
